metadata.title: CVE-2021-29974 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When network partitioning was enabled, e.g. as a result of EnhancedTracking Protection settings, a TLS error page would allow the user tooverride an error on a domain which had specified HTTP Strict TransportSecurity (which implies that the error should not be override-able.) Thisissue did not affect the network connections, and they were correctlyupgraded to HTTPS automatically. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 90.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29974` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
